SWK300.title: SWK 300 Service Learning in Social Work
SWK300.req: Prerequisite: 30 hours and concurrent enrollment in a social work course designated as a service learning offering (SWK 200, SWK 219, or SWK 306).
SWK300.desc: This service component for an existing course incorporates community service with classroom instruction to provide an integrative learning experience that addresses the practice of citizenship and promotes an awareness of and participation in public affairs. Includes 40 hours of service that benefits an external community organization or human/social service agency. Approved settings will focus on populations-at-risk, diverse populations and groups that have experienced social and economic injustice. A list of approved placements and assignments is available from the instructor and the Citizenship and Service Learning Office. May be repeated. Graded Pass/Not Pass only.

SWK306.title: SWK 306 Interviewing Skills in Generalist Social Work Practice
SWK306.desc: An introduction to basic interviewing skills based upon the purpose of and plan for the interview in the context of generalist social work practice.

SWK307.title: SWK 307 Social Work Practice with Individuals
SWK307.req: Prerequisite: admission to the BSW program; and SWK 306.
SWK307.desc: Basic principles, practice theories and skill for beginning generalist practice with individuals. Integrates practice theory and intervention skills within the context of the Generalist Intervention/Problem-Solving model. The class emphasizes personal awareness, professional growth, critical thinking and skills practice.

SWK313.title: SWK 313 Social Justice
SWK313.req: Prerequisite: admission to the BSW program; and ECO 155 or ECO 165 or concurrent enrollment in ECO 155 or ECO 165; and PLS 101.
SWK313.desc: The primary subject matter of this course is social and economic inequality in United States society. Students are introduced to the patterns and processes of social and economic inequality in its major forms: class, race/ethnicity, gender, and sexual and political orientation.

SWK314.title: SWK 314 Social Welfare Policy and Services II
SWK314.req: Prerequisite: admission to the BSW program; and SWK 213.
SWK314.desc: An introduction to the analytic, interactional, value clarification and political strategies necessary for policy analysis and implementation.

SWK320.title: SWK 320 Services for Women
SWK320.desc: Examination of the multiple problems women experience, and needed community resources. Areas of study broadly include women and health, violence against women, women and socio-economic status.

SWK325.title: SWK 325 Human Behavior and the Social Environment I
SWK325.req: Prerequisite: admission to the BSW program; PSY 121 and SOC 150 or concurrent enrollment in PSY 121 and SOC 150; and BIO 101 and 111, or BMS 100 or BMS 105 or BMS 110.
SWK325.desc: An introduction to the dynamics of human behavior and the effects of the social environment on the development of individuals and families.
